ratings.comment: I took this class having so-so feelings about my previous Latin TAs but Jason is really fantastic.  He makes every class engaging and has a lot of supplementary knowledge that is a bit much at times but neat.  Also, extra credit saved my life.  It's a fair amount, and mostly supplements learning.  Few quizzes and he gives you lots of prep material.

He was a great instructor. He gave background on the language that made it much more interesting to learn, he was enthusiastic about learning, he was extremely caring and understanding, and he was very knowledgeable and approachable. I'd definitely take another class with him.
Jason works hard to make sure his students have all the resources they need.  By far my favorite class this semester. Thanks Jason :)

He's really knowledgeable and patient, and never runs out of lame history jokes. You can tell he really cares about his students, and goes above and beyond for them. The class structure and expectations were very straightforward and doable. If you get a chance to have Jason as your TA, take that chance!
Jason is the best Latin TA there is. Classes are relaxed and friendly, and you'll be sure to pick up a bunch of interesting tidbits from Jason.
Awesome instructor. I feel privileged to have had him. Couldn't have asked for anyone better.
An honour and a privilege to a prodigy of the great Jason Hansen!
Jason is one of the best TAs I've had. Very approachable and great sense of humor. Would definitely recommend and take another class with him! And I hope he'll win his bet
Fantastic TA for a tough professor

Jason is amazing.  He really loves what he does, and is always ready to help answer any questions you have (no matter how irrelevant).  Just humor him and you'll be find.  Who knows, you might even catch yourself *gasp* enjoying the class!

Great sense of humor and builds a good atmosphere for class participation and team exercises. Has high standards for papers along with accessibility and support that result real learning and growth. Would definitely recommend him.

He was really helpful either in office hours, after class, or over e-mail.  In his discussions, he does different types of activities to keep class interesting and useful to attend.   Overall, he's an amazing instructor and I would take more classes with him!
One of the best TAs I've had during my time at the university. Knows what he is doing and is always trying to get the best out of his students and is very approachable.
Jason was interesting and fun. Great TA. 10/10 would recommend.
I'm just giving this rating so Jason can win his T.A. bet.

Jason's awesome, he knows a lot about the material and explains almost anything you have to ask. To top it off, he's just a cool guy in general. Made discussion a whole lot better than I thought it'd be.
Jason is completely dedicated to the topic and goes above and beyond for his students. I had a great discussion with him and would take him again.

I really liked Jason. He was kind of geeky but very fun and discussion was actually very enjoyable because of it. He made classics fun and his love of the subject was very contagious. I hope to get him in more classics classes in the future.
He was my TA for Classics 370 and frankly, his teaching is the only reason why I understood the characters in the plays we read. I would always leave the discussion feeling like it was valuable.

Jason has an amazing knowledge base of the material, which makes understandings the readings much easier. He gets everyone involved in discussion which helps you learn more, so it is not an easy participation grade, but he will help your overall grade go up drastically.

He is really passionate about the class and makes it enjoyable to learn about different greek myths. I definitely would recommend taking him! He makes you think for yourself but also makes sure you understand the material.
Jason was a great TA for classics 370.  He is clearly passionate about the subject which helped make the class more enjoyable.  If you have the chance to take him, I would recommend it!
